list_definition.definition: to set free; to allow to leave

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was released from prison yesterday
I am willing to release him from his promise to me.

list_definition.definition: to stop holding etc; to allow to move, fall etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He released (his hold on) the rope.

list_definition.definition: to move (a catch, brake etc) which prevents something else from moving, operating etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He released the handbrake and drove off.

list_definition.definition: to allow (news etc) to be made known publicly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The list of winners has just been released.

list_definition.definition: to offer (a film, record etc) to the general public

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Their latest record will be released next week.

list_definition.definition: the act of releasing or being released

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: After his release, the prisoner returned to his home town
the release of a new film
This record is their latest release
The Government issued a press release (= a statement giving information about something, sent or given to newspapers, reporters etc).
